properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in effect for the Walk with Christ Religious Procession in the Sydney CBD between 2.30pm and 4.30pm from Martin Place to St Marys Cathedral.

Traffic will be heavy in the city while roads are closed. Motorists should avoid unnecessary travel through the city where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures:

  • From 2:30pm to 4:30pm sections of Pitt, O'Connell, Bligh, Spring, Castlereagh, Phillip, King, Elizabeth, George and Hunter Streets will close.
  • From 2:50pm to 4:30pm sections of College St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd and St James Rd will close.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm until 4pm on sections of College, Hunter, Macquarie and Pitt Streets. Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 2.30PM TO 4.30PM

  • Bligh Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place
  • Castlereagh Street between Hunter Street and King Street
  • Elizabeth Street between Market Street and King Street (northbound only)   
  • Elizabeth Street between King Street and Hunter Street
  • George Street between Margaret Street and Hunter Street (southbound only)
  • Hunter Street between George Street and Pitt Street (eastbound only)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street
  • King Street between Phillip Street and Elizabeth Street
  • O Connell Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street    
  • Phillip Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street 
  • Phillip Street between Hunter Street and King Street    
  • Spring Street between Gresham Street and Pitt Street

FROM 2.50PM TO 4.30PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and Park Street   
  • Macquarie Street between Bent Street and St James Road   
  • Prince Albert Road between Macquarie Street and St Maryâ€™s Road
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Macquarie Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones that apply to all vehicle types, and to local residents, businesses or Transport for New South Wales Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 1PM TO 4PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and William Street (eastern side)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street (both sides)
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street (western side)
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place (eastern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event in Haymarket. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed in both directions between Sussex St and Harbour St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber Ln and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

properties.publicTransport: Ticketholders are encouraged to catch public transport as parking at the Zoo and in surrounding streets is very limited. Ferries and buses run regularly to Taronga Zoo from the city and north shore. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney's iconic Tarong Zoo will light up during Vivid Sydney for two ticketed sessions at 5.30pm and 7.30pm on Wednesday to Sunday nights including public Holiday Monday. Pre-purchased event tickets are required.

Road closures may be in place on Bradleys Head Rd between the Zoo entry and Zoo wharf to manage large crowds and access to car parks. Follow directions of traffic controllers and Zoo staff on site.

Motorists should expect delays on Military Rd, Spit Rd and Bradleys Head Rd as attendees travel to the Zoo ahead of each session.

Commuters are advised to allow additional travel time through Mosman during the evening peak on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights during Vivid.

roads.mainStreet: Bradleys Head Road, Military Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Michael Bublé at Qudos Bank Arena. Acts start from 8pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the venue, particularly on Friday during the busy evening peak.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Eels at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 4pm, full-time around 5.45pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice: Road closures will be in place on Saturday 10 June 2023 for the Merriwa Festival of the Fleeces. The Golden Highway will be closed between Dutton St and Marquet St from 4am to 6pm. Motorists will be detoured around the highway closure via Marquet St, Blaxland St and Dutton St. Motorists travelling through Merriwa over the long weekend should allow extra travel time and expect delays.
properties.diversions: The Golden Highway will be closed between Dutton St and Marquet St from 4am to 6pm. Motorists will be detoured around the highway closure via Marquet St, Blaxland St and Dutton St.

roads.mainStreet: Golden Highway

webLinks.linkText: FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™️ Sydney Harbour Bridge Unity Celebration

properties.publicTransport: Buses will start and end trips either side of the Harbour Bridge in North Sydney and in the city while it's closed to traffic. Trains will continue to operate across the bridge. The cycleway and walkway will also remain open. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A ticketed FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™️ Sydney Harbour Bridge Unity Celebration event will be held on the Bridge deck on Sunday morning from 7.30am.

The Harbour Bridge and Cahill Expressway will be closed in both directions from 4am to 10.30am. The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway will remain open.

Motorists will be diverted via the Sydney Harbour Tunnel however delays are expected, drivers are urged to avoid the area until after 10.30am where possible.

Key road closures

  • From 4am to 10:30am: all lanes of the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions including the Cahill Expressway Circular Overpass. A section of Burton St at Milsons Point will remain closed until 11.30am.
  • Motorists will be diverted via the Sydney Harbour Tunnel in both directions. Drivers can also consider using Victoria Rd and Gladesville Bridge as an alternative route.
  • Citybound traffic from the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via Bathurst St off-ramp and all traffic accessing the Western Distributor from Fig St and Pyrmont St will be detoured via the King St off-ramp.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect in North Sydney and the Sydney CBD to accommodate traffic on detour routes while the bridge is closed.

  • In North Sydney and Milsons Point from 3am to 10.30am: on Pacific Hwy between Berry and Walker Streets, a section of Alfred St South and Burton St.
  • In Sydney CBD from 6am to 10.30am: on sections of Sussex, King, Elizabeth, Park, Bathurst, Clarence, York, William and Riley Streets.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
MILSONS POINT

From 4:00am to 11:30pm

  • Burton Street between Alfred Street South and Broughton Street  

CAHILL EXPRESSWAY - ALL RAMPS AND APPROACHES

FROM 4:00AM TO 10:30AM

  • Cahill Exp overpass between Bradfield Highway, Conservatorium Road & Domain Tunnel

SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE - ALL RAMPS AND APPROACHES

FROM 4:00AM TO 10:30AM

  • Bradfield Highway (Sydney Harbour Bridge) Lanes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6
  • Cahill Expressway (Sydney Harbour Bridge) Lanes 7 and 8
  • Pacific Highway between Bradfield Highway and High Street
  • Pacific Highway between Lavender Street and Blue Street
  • Warringah Freeway all access ramps and lanes to/from Sydney Harbour Bridge

WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR

FROM 4:00AM TO 10:30AM

Connecting ramps between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed. Access will be maintained to Sydney CBD via ANZAC Bridge and the Pyrmont Street and Fig Street on ramps, exiting to the Bathurst Street and King Street off ramps.

Western Distributor

  • ANZAC Bridge on ramp1 from Darling Harbour overpass
  • Cross City Tunnel exit2 to Harbour Street / CBD North Northbound
  • Western Distributor3 between Bathurst Street and Bradfield Highway Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge southern on-ramp between Grosvenor Street and Bradfield Hwy Northbound
  • Harbour Street between Bathurst Street and Western Distributor on-ramp to SHB
  • Western Distributor between Bradfield Highway and Blackwattle Place Southbound

Notes:

1 Traffic will be detoured to the King Street off ramp into Sydney CBD.

2 The Cross City Tunnel exit southbound to Bathurst Street will remain open.

3 Managed access available to Wheat Road for King Street Wharf and Barangaroo South precincts.

 

King Street wharf access

Motorists will be able to access King Street Wharf precinct via Erskine Street and Wheat Road. Erskine Street is the recommended approach as the Wheat Road approaches are expected to become heavier as the morning progresses.

Wheat Road approaches:

·       from the Western Distributor - Bathurst Street exit: left via the slip lane onto the Western Distributor then left into Wheat Road. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge.

·       from Harbour Street northbound at Bathurst Street: managed access straight ahead then left into Wheat Road. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge

properties.displayName: FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™️ special event

roads.mainStreet: Sydney Harbour Bridge, Cahill Expressway Overpass

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Roosters at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 3pm, full time around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Griffiths Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Supanova Comic Con & Gaming at Sydney Showground. Starts daily at 10am, finishes at 6pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic will be particularly busy on Saturday evening as other events also take place in the precinct. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with increased ride share and taxis in the area.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Attendees driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
McKell Cup Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race from 4:25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: James Ruse Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Storm at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 7:35pm, full time approx 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Bulldogs at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full time around 6pm. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

roads.mainStreet: Captain Cook Drive

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Sea Eagles at CommBank Stadium. NRL kick-off from 5:30pm, finish around 7:20pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 6:50pm to 7:50pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.otherAdvice: The Maitland State Netball Championships will be held on Saturday 10 June to Monday 12 June 2023 at the Maitland Netball Courts. Motorists are advised to take extra caution in the area as there is an expected increase in pedestrian activity on Les Darcy Drive. There will be local road traffic management in place, please follow the direction of traffic controllers and signage in place.

roads.mainStreet: Les Darcy Drive

properties.publicTransport: Route 55 buses will be diverted between 8am and 9am via Glenrock Parade. From 7am to 11am buses leaving Gosford Station will be diverted via Baker St, Georgiana Terrace and Dane Dr while Riou St is closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Bay to Bay Running Festival will be held on Sunday 18 June 2023 from 7am between Woy Woy and Gosford.

Key roads will be closed for the event:

  • The Boulevarde, Woy Woy between Brisbane Water Drive and Brick Wharf Road from 5.00am, 17 June to 11.30am, 18 June 2023.
  • Rolling closure of Brisbane Water Drive from Blackwall Road to Glenrock Parade with various side local roads that intersect with Brisbane Water Drive from 7.30am to 9am
  • Riou Street, Gosford, southbound between Donnison Street and Central Coast Highway from 7am to 11am
  • Dane Drive, Gosford, between Donnison Street and Georgiana Terrace from 7am to 12pm
  • Alfred Higgs Place, Gosford between the roundabout on Central Coast Highway to the carpark underneath Brian McGowan Bridge from 5am to 1pm. 

Motorists travelling between Gosford and Woy Woy will be diverted via Woy Woy Rd. Local access into Tascott and Koolewong will be via Glenrock Pde. Motorists should avoid the area during the event but if travel is necessary, allow extra travel time and follow the directions of Police and traffic controllers on site.

roads.mainStreet: Brisbane Water Drive

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will run after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Dolphins at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Preliminary match from 5:45pm. NRL kick-off from 8pm and full-time around 9:50pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pittwater Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Panthers at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.35pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.35pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney SYDNEY CBD, CIRCULAR QUAY, THE ROCKS, WALSH BAY, BARANGAROO, DARLING HARBOUR George Street, Hickson Road
properties.publicTransport:
Transport changes will be in effect during Vivid Sydney

  • On Fridays from 6pm and from 5pm on weekends including Monday public holiday buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only.
  • On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay from 6pm to 11pm.
  • Drone show nights: from 9pm to 10.30pm on Wed 14 June light rail services will not run between Town Hall and Circular Quay to allow crowds to safely clear the area. From 8.30pm to 9.30pm on Mon 12 and Wed 14 June trains will not stop at Circular Quay Station platform 2. Alight at Wynyard and walk to Circular Quay.

Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 13th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 26 May to Saturday 17 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect each night. 

Large crowds are expected over the long weekend, visitors of Vivid Sydney should leave the car at home and catch transport as heavy traffic is expected.

Nightly - CLOSURES IN PLACE

  • 12pm - midnight: Cumberland St south of Essex St.
  • 3pm - midnight: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.
  • Each weekend From 2pm Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for the Rocks markets.

Saturdays and Sunday (11 June) of the long weekend - CLOSURES IN PLACE

  • 5pm - 1am: major closures in Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay, including sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St, Jamison St, Margaret St, Hunter St, George St north of King St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Windmill St, Lower Fort St, Argyle Pl, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets north of Bridge St, and Railway Colonnade at Central Station. No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm - 11pm: Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

The cycleway on Pitt St between Underwood St and Bridge St will closed each Saturday night and Sunday 11 June from 5pm to midnight.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends.

From 7am Friday 12 May to 1am Saturday 24 June clearways are in effect on Hickson Rd from opposite Pier One Hotel to the end of the parking bay (southbound, all parking spaces). From 9pm Wed 24 May to 1am Sun 18 June clearways are in effect on Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (Eastbound).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.


Millers Point, Dawes Point

From 7am Friday 12 May to 1am Saturday 24 June

  • Hickson Road from accessibility parking opposite Pier One Hotel to end of the parking bay before joining Hickson Road Southbound, all parking spaces

From 9pm Wed 24 May to 1am Sun 18 June

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Bridge St, Grosvenor Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo, Darling Harbour

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Rabbitohs at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. NRL kick-off from 3pm and full time approx. 4:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race from 4:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street
